sentences: Osta see, mis on kõige parimat.
context: The word 'parimat' is the superlative form of the adjective 'parem' (better) in Estonian. It means 'the best' and is used to indicate something that is superior to all others. As a superlative, it typically appears with partitive case endings (-t) and is often preceded by words like 'kõige' (most).
